title: ICE broken MIR when updating to 1.56.0 and edition 2021

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-bisection
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs bisection: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo-bisect-rustc

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
We just migrated to 1.56.0 and edition 2021 (from 1.53.0). This resulted in some internal compiler errors when using a let binding for an enum with a single variant (`let Enum::Variant(it) = it`). This issue is not present in `rustc 1.53.0`. I can unfortunately not share our repository and I have not been able to recreate this error elsewhere. I will do my best to provide additional information if needed. Summary: ``` warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId ... can't project out of PlaceTy ... error: TyKind::Error constructed but no error reported ``` More in the logs below. ### Code ```Rust impl ContentScope { #[instrument(skip(global_state))] pub async fn has_permission(self, client: Client, global_state: &GlobalState) -> Result<()> { // This doesn't ICE // match self { // ContentScope::Group(group_ref) => { // client.check_permission(group_ref, global_state).await // } // } let ContentScope::Group(group_ref) = self; client.check_permission(group_ref, global_state).await } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0 (09c42c458 2021-10-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: 09c42c45858d5f3aedfa670698275303a3d19afa commit-date: 2021-10-18 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.56.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ```rust warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory `\\?\C:\Users\rasvi\Configura\web-rnd\cbb\target\debug\incremental\cbbapi-9d7mgtv9wzcv\s-g3in3aqwi6-fhge86-working`: The system cannot find the file specified. (os error 2) error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:8434 ~ cbbapi[111c]::regional_state::content::{impl#0}::has_permission::{closure#0}) ((_3.0: global_state::group::GroupRef)): can't project out of PlaceTy { ty: regional_state::content::ContentScope, variant_index: None } --> cbbapi\src\regional_state\content.rs:41:96 | 41 | pub async fn has_permission(self, client: Client, global_state: &GlobalState) -> Result<()> { | _________________________________________________________________________________________________^ 42 | | // This doesn't ICE 43 | | // match self { 44 | | // ContentScope::Group(group_ref) => { ... | 50 | | client.check_permission(group_ref, global_state).await 51 | | } | |_____^ | = note: delayed at compiler\rustc_mir\src\borrow_check\type_check\mod.rs:308:27 error: internal compiler error: TyKind::Error constructed but no error reported | = note: delayed at compiler\rustc_mir\src\borrow_check\type_check\mod.rs:777:20 error: internal compiler error: TyKind::Error constructed but no error reported | = note: delayed at /rustc/09c42c45858d5f3aedfa670698275303a3d19afa\compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\relate.rs:382:59 error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:8435 ~ cbbapi[111c]::regional_state::content::{impl#0}::has_permission::{closure#0}::{closure#0}) (((_1.0: global_state::group::GroupRef).0: global_state::group::GroupRef)): bad field access (global_state::customer::CustomerId: global_state::group::GroupRef): NoSolution --> cbbapi\src\regional_state\content.rs:49:33 | 49 | let ContentScope::Group(group_ref) = self; | ^^^^^^^^^ | = note: delayed at compiler\rustc_mir\src\borrow_check\type_check\mod.rs:308:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1166:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0 (09c42c458 2021-10-18) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` ```
